snippet: A trade group reported a jump in production and hiring at factories, which could accelerate economic growth that has been sluggish in recent months.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports that its index of factory activity jumped to 55.4 percent in July from 50.9 percent in June, indicating strong growth; data indicates that factories nationwide revved up production, hired more workers and received surge of new orders.
lead_paragraph: A trade group reported a jump in production and hiring at factories, which could accelerate economic growth that has been sluggish in recent months.

headline.main: Increased Factory Activity May Bolster U.S. Recovery
headline.print_headline: Increased Factory Activity May Bolster U.S. Recovery
